As you may be aware, Braintree High School (BHS) has modified the Class of 2020’s graduation plans due to COVID-19 health concerns. While an in-person ceremony is planned for July 30th BHS, in coordination with the Town of Braintree, has scheduled a parade-style graduation for Seniors this Saturday, June 13th at 9:00AM.

Graduating BHS Seniors and family members will participate in the parade in their own vehicles. The parade of cars will leave the RMV at 9AM and make its way past Town Hall and then to the John W. LeRoy, Jr. Access Road.

The Braintree Police Department also wants to remind all town residents that the parade will cause significant road closures and traffic diversions starting at 9:00 on Saturday the 13th.

We ask that anyone interested in viewing the parade do so along the public roads in a socially distant way. (The BHS Property and Access Road will be closed to the public for viewing.) A livestream video of the parade will also be available on the Braintree Public School’s Facebook page.

We hope you’ll join us in congratulating the Class of 2020.
